Kingsburgh Junction is a shopping centre currently under construction situated in Doonside, Kingsburgh on the South Coast of KwaZulu-Natal, South Africa. It is expected to serve the coastal towns of Kingsburgh and eManzimtoti located south of Durban.
The Kingsburgh Junction development, first announced in 2021, has seen its opening date shift several times; originally slated for November 2023, later postponed to October 2024, and now rescheduled for March 2026.
Location
Kingsburgh Junction will be situated on the suburb of Doonside on the northern boundary of Kingsburgh with eManzimtoti. Furthermore, it will be situated on the corner of Seadoone Road and Umfuleni Road, directly adjacent to the N2/Seadoone Road interchange (Exit 137).
The site was selected to provide retail convenience for the residents of the Kingsburgh suburbs of Doonside, Doon Heights, Shulton Park, Illovo Glen as well as the southern portions of eManzimtoti.
Tenants
According to AJ Property Holdings, 90% of the lettable space in Kingsburgh Junction has been pre-let. Anchor tenants will include Superspar (including Tops @ Spar and Vida e Caff√®), Woolworths and Dis-Chem. Other well-known national retailers that will be joining the tenant list include Pep, Pep Home, Ackermans, KFC (Drive-Thru) and Pedro's.
